subject: History
title: Cultural Exchange of the Crusades
description: A quick, practical guide to Cultural Exchange of the Crusades.

hook.text: The Crusades were bloody failures militarily. Culturally, they accidentally changed Europe forever.

buildup.text: Crusaders returned home with spices, silk, sugar, and new ideas about medicine and mathematics.

discovery.text: Arabic numerals replaced clumsy Roman ones. New surgical techniques saved European lives.

twist.text: The taste for Eastern luxury goods revived European trade networks and helped create the merchant class.

climax.text: The Crusades didn't conquer the East. Instead, the East quietly conquered European tastes.

punchline.text: Europe went to teach and came home a student.

quiz.question: What lasting cultural impact did the Crusades have on Europe?
options: They permanently Christianized the Middle East
They introduced spices, Arabic numerals, and new trade
